results.title: A further study on antihypertensive action of beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents in conscious, renal hypertensive dogs.
results.text_hl: Experiments were carried out on 7 conscious, @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@renal hypertensive@@@ dogs with 7 beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_bunitrolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:C084811 @@@bunitrolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Bunolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D064805 @@@bunolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Carteolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002354 @@@carteolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Himori N, Ishimori T, Taira N. A further study on antihypertensive action of beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents in conscious, renal hypertensive dogs. Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther. 1979 Nov;242(1):115-27. PMID: 44454
citations.BibTeX: @article{44454, title={A further study on antihypertensive action of beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents in conscious, renal hypertensive dogs.}, author={Himori N and Ishimori T and Taira N}, journal={Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther}, volume={242}, number={1}, pages={115-27}}

results.title: Design and baseline characteristics of participants in the African American Study of Kidney Disease and Hypertension (AASK) Pilot Study.
results.text_hl: The African American Study of @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@Kidney Disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@Hypertension@@@ (AASK) Pilot Study evaluated the feasibility of conducting a long-term clinical trial to compare the effects of two levels of blood pressure control and three different antihypertensive drug regimens on the rate of decline in glomerular filtration rate (GFR) in African Americans with clinically diagnosed @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@hypertensive renal disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Wright JT Jr, Kusek JW, Toto RD, Lee JY, Agodoa LY, Kirk KA, Randall OS, Glassock R. Design and baseline characteristics of participants in the African American Study of Kidney Disease and Hypertension (AASK) Pilot Study. Control Clin Trials. 1996 Aug;17(4 Suppl):3S-16S. PMID: 8889350
citations.BibTeX: @article{8889350, title={Design and baseline characteristics of participants in the African American Study of Kidney Disease and Hypertension (AASK) Pilot Study.}, author={Wright JT Jr and Kusek JW and Toto RD and Lee JY and Agodoa LY and Kirk KA and Randall OS and Glassock R}, journal={Control Clin Trials}, volume={17}, number={4 Suppl}, pages={3S-16S}}
